intro: Pimpinella multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
